name: Markdown

props.name: codeBackground
props.description: Optional override for code block background

bestPractices: Keep input trusted or sanitized. Do not feed untrusted Markdown unless you sanitize it first.
Prefer concise content. Split very long documents into sections with clear headings.
Use fenced code blocks with a language hint for syntax highlighting.
Avoid relying on raw HTML inside Markdown; prefer pure Markdown for predictability.
Choose `codeBackground` to ensure code blocks maintain sufficient contrast across themes.
Use descriptive link text. For internal navigation in SPAs, prefer router links or intercept anchors to avoid full page reloads.
Maintain a proper heading hierarchy (h1 → h2 → h3). Keep one top-level title per page and use lower levels within Markdown.
Always include meaningful alt text on images; keep images responsive and reasonably sized.
Keep tables concise, include a header row, and use column alignment markers (:-, :-:, -:) for clarity.
Treat GFM task list checkboxes as status indicators; don’t expect them to be interactive in rendered Markdown.
For advanced code UX (copy/download, long snippets), use the dedicated CodeBlock widget instead of plain fenced blocks.
If enabling raw HTML rendering in the future, run content through a robust sanitizer before passing to Markdown.
Avoid huge images and extremely long single documents. Split content and load lazily when possible for performance.
